results.title: The Cup
results.creator_credit: Khyentse Norbu, Malcolm Watson, Raymond Steiner, Hanway Films and Palm Pictures
results.brief_description: It is 1998 and World Cup fever has reached as far as a monastery in the Indian Himalayas. Here, young Orgyen and fellow monks are taken with the excitement of the cup final approaching, their only dilemma is how are they going to be able to watch the final without a TV. ‘The Cup’ is a delightful comedy that looks at how a group of novice monks can come up with money to rent a TV and seek the permission of their leader, Geko, who is firm handed, and Khempo, the older and slightly more easy going leader. Written and directed by Khyentse Norbu who was himself a Buddhist monk, this is the first film to be released in the Tibetan language. In Bhutanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Paragraph 175
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Robert Epstein, Channel Four Films, Home Box Office and Telling Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary about the Nazi persecution of homosexuals during the Third Reich, reveals the lasting consequences of this little known chapter of 20th century history through the personal recollections of six survivors. Between 1933 and 1945, 100,000 men were arrested for homosexuality under Paragraph 175, the unenforced sodomy provision of the German penal code dating back to 1871. Some were imprisoned, others were sent to concentration camps. Of the latter, only about 4,000 survived. By the 1920s, Berlin had become known as a homosexual Eden where gay men and lesbians lived relatively open lives amidst a thriving community of artists and intellectuals, however with the coming to power of the Nazis, Paragraph 175 was revived to brutally crush this culture. Combined with archival images and an historical account of gay culture preceding and during the Third Reich, the moving testimonies of the now very elderly five men and one women raise provocative questions about memory, history, and identity. In English, German and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Grace of my heart
results.creator_credit: Allison Anders, Daniel Hassid, Elliott Lewis Rose, Ruth Charny, Cappa, Gramercy Pictures and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: In “Grace of My Heart” Allison Anders has used a number of rock’n roll reference points, creating character pastiches of famed musicians, producers and industry types. None of the characters directly match up to their real life counterparts, but the similarities are clear. Broadly based on the life of Carol King, ” Grace of My Heart” tells the story of Denise Waverly (Illeana Douglas), who starts her career as a want to be singer from Philadelphia, and goes on to become a successful songwriter. The story traces the long journey of personal discovery she must go through to ultimately become all that she wants to be. The film sets itself among the corridors of the famed Brill Building during the doo-wop heyday of the late fifties all the way through Malibu’s psychedelic surfer scene of the late sixties. With period costuming and a wall-to-wall pop soundtrack featuring the likes of Elvis Costello, Burt Bacharach, Lesley Gore, Carole Bayer Sager, J Mascis and Sonic Youth. Also starring John Turturro as Denise’s mentor and record-producer, Eric Stoltz as husband number 1, and Matt Dillon as husband number 2.

results.title: X-Men
results.creator_credit: Bryan Singer, Lauren Shuler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The concentration camps of World War 2 is an unlikely place to start this faithful film adaptation of the long running Marvel comic series. Director Bryan Singer however quickly makes the connection apparent as this tale of difference and intolerance unfolds. Set mainly in an unspecified future, ‘X-men’ sets up the premise that human evolution has taken un unexpected leap when various children are born with a gene that mutates into extraordinary super powers. These special beings however are met with suspicion and fear by the wider community, in particular right wing Senator Robert Kelly (Bruce Davison), who wants to register the much maligned ‘mutants’. Singer carefully introduces us into the labyrinth world of the X-men by following the plight of shy teenager Marie D’Acanto (Anna Paquin), who discovers, much to her horror, that she has the power to absorb the life out of anyone she touches. Through her we meet Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), a dangerous loner who, when provoked, protrudes steel blades out of his knuckles, as well as the rest of the X-men who reside in a special school set up by the wheel chair bound and telepathic Professor Xavier (Patrick Stewart). Of course every super hero must have it’s villain and a powerful foe is created in the mysterious and tormented Magnetto (Ian McKellen), a mutant who has the ability to harness magnetic energy and wants to start a war between the intolerant humans and the mutants. Cast also includes Halle Berry, Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Rebecca Romjin-Stamos and Ray Park.

results.title: Rude awakening
results.creator_credit: David Greenwalt, Aaron Russo and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Rude awakening is just that, when hippies Hesus and Fred return to New York after spending twenty years at a hippie commune in Central America, they find that things have not stayed the same and are in for one awakening they did not expect. They return to New York armed with Government papers that fell into their hands informing them of a proposed war in Central America. Needing the help and support of their old friends, they soon find they have changed from the once youthful free spirited drug taking hippies, to the uptight hard nosed yuppies that they used to despise. “Rude awakening” looks at the environmental challenges our world faces and the reluctance by people to stand up and express their anger and objection to the destruction of a highly delicate world in which we live. Cast includes Eric Roberts, Cheech Marin, Robert Carradine and Julie Hagerty.

results.title: The Grinch
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: In Whoville, the Whos are overexcited, preparing for both Christmas, and the town’s ‘Whobelation’, a celebration of everything ‘Who’. The Grinch (Jim Carrey), living on Mount Crumpet overlooking the town of Whoville, despises everything about the holiday season and the town (due to a bad childhood Christmas experience) and decides to stop the festive season all together. Meanwhile, down in Whoville little Cindy Lou Who is trying to discover the true meaning behind Christmas and believes the Grinch might have the answers. A live-action adaptation of Dr. Seuss’s Christmas classic ‘How the Grinch Stole Christmas’, narrated by Anthony Hopkins. Cast also includes Molly Shannon, Christine Baranski, Bill Irwin and Jeffrey Tambor.

results.title: Unhook the stars
results.creator_credit: Nick Cassavetes, Panos Nicolaou, Rene Cleitman and Hachette Premiere
results.brief_description: Gena Rowlands portrays a middle-aged widow whose life is on the threshold of change. Her daughter has just left home on less than amicable terms and her married son is totally absorbed in his own life. When Mildred is approached by her neighbour (Marissa Tomei) to mind her young son, JJ, after her abusive husband walks out, she immediately consents. Initially quiet and tentative, JJ gradually gains confidence as the two develop a strong bond which provides them with the support they lack from their own families. The film explores the evolving relationship between Mildred and her two children, contrasting it to the unconditional friendship she shares with JJ. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Marisa Tomei, Gerard Depardieu and Jake Lloyd. Edited by Petra Von Oelffen. Photographed by Phedon Papamichael. Written by Nick Cassavetes and Helen Caldwell.

results.title: Death of a salesman [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Robert F. Colesberry and Roxbury and Punch
results.brief_description: This play, written by Arthur Miller, is one of the enduring glories of the American theatre. This adaptation was filmed within the confines of a Broadway stage set, thereby enhancing the intimacy of the study of the disintegration of the travelling salesman. Flashbacks are adroitly interwoven with the current scenes, providing a build-up to the shattering climax. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman and John Malkovich.

results.title: Man of marble = Czlowiek z marmuru [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Film Polski and Zespol Filmowy 'X'
results.brief_description: Lauded a national hero in the 1950s due to his skills at his trade, Mateusz Birkut has fallen into the shadows. In making a film of the bricklayer’s life, documentary director Krystyna Janda discovers that he used his fame to become involved in politics - resulting in the government wiping out all traces of his accomplishments. Excised by the Polish censors when first released, ‘Man of marble’ uses reconstructions of old black and white newsreels and matches the stylistic tenets of the documentary genre. (Awards: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, Cannes Film Festival, 1978). In Polish with English subtitles.
